Text.text: Which of the following does NOT help explain how your major connects with possible careers?
Career Services Center
Incorrect. Try again!
Undergraduate Research Office
Incorrect. Undergraduate research can help you see what a career in research might be like. Try again!
Office of Academic Enrichment
Incorrect. Online workshops through the Office of Academic Enrichment can help explain you decide on a major and future career. Try again!
All of the above are correct
Correct! All of the above resources help explain how your major connects with possible careers.
If you are considering changing your major, which resource CANNOT best answer your questions?
Your resident assistant
Correct! Your resident assistant is not a trained expert about the different majors and career possibilities available. The RA's purpose is rather to help you adjust to campus life.
Career Services Center
Incorrect! The Career Services Center provides information on which careers are available and how different majors connect to career options.
Your advisor
Incorrect! Your advisor may be helpful in answering your questions or directing you to people who can.
Office of Academic Enrichment
Incorrect! The Office of Academic Enrichment provides online workshops about choosing and declaring a major.
Which of these services does the Career Services Center provide?
Networking opportunities with potential employers
Incorrect. Try again!
Workshops on resumes, LinkedIn profiles, and interviews
Incorrect. Try again!
Self exploration
Incorrect. Try again!
All of the above
Correct! The Career Services Center provides all of these resources and more.
Which of the following is NOT a true statement about the Career Services Center?
It is located next to Perkins Student Center
Incorrect. Career Services is located at 401 Academy Street, right next to the Perkins Student Center.
You do not need an appointment to have your resume reviewed by staff
Incorrect. You may bring in your resume to receive feedback from Career Services staff from Monday-Friday from 2:00 - 4:00 pm.
Free parking is provided
Correct. Parking is available at the Perkins Parking Garage, but it is not free of charge after 15 minutes.
Information about graduate school is available.
Incorrect. Information about selecting and applying to graduate, medical, and law schools is available on the Career Services website.
Which of the following can NOT be found in the Career Services Student Portal online?
Information on upcoming workshops
Incorrect: information on upcoming workshops CAN be found in the Career Services Student Portal.
Your grades
Correct! Your grades CANNOT be found in the Career Services Student Portal, but they can be found on UDSIS.
Advice for filling out grad school applications
Incorrect: the Career Services Student Portal DOES contain advice for filling out graduate school applications.
A place to have your resume approved
Incorrect: there IS a place to have your resume approved in the Career Services Student Portal.
How does the Career Services Center provide help with writing your resume?
By offering free resume reviews from 2:00 â€“ 4:00 pm every week day
Incorrect: this is not the only way that the Career Services Center provides help with writing your resume!
By holding resumes on workshops
By reviewing resumes online through the Career Services Student Portal
Incorrect: this is not the only way that the Career Services Center provides help with writing your resume!
All of the above
Correct! These are all ways that the Career Services Center provides resume writing assistance.
